method.name: ToHexRgb
method.summary: Creates a 7 byte, include hash, hex response.
method.returns: HEX string without the Alpha channel. e.g. #CC00CC

method.name: ToHexArgb
method.summary: Creates a 9 byte, include hash, hex response.
method.returns: HEX string with the Alpha channel. e.g. #FFCC00CC

method.name: FGAscii
method.summary: Creates an Ascii string for text color within a Console windows. Supports 24bit color.
method.returns: Ascii string representing text color for consoles use. e.g. "\x1b[38;5;255;255;0m" - True 24bit Yellow

method.name: BGAscii
method.summary: Creates an Ascii string for background color behind text within a Console windows. Supports 24bit color.
method.returns: Ascii string representing background color for consoles use. e.g. "\x1b[48;5;255;0;0m" - True 24bit Red

method.name: ResetAscii
method.summary:
Color Extension: returns a Ascii Esape string that can be used in Console windows during Console.Write/WriteLine.
This string will reset all foreground and background console colors back to default from the time of write.
method.returns: Ascii Escape string with value of: "\x1b[0m"

method.name: ApplyBgColor
method.summary:
Uses existing color as foreground, overlay it on top of arguement background color, and return a new RGB color.
If foreground color doesn't have any transparency, it will return foreground color as the new color.

param.name: bgColor
param.summary: Color object to use as Background Color

method.name: ApplyFgColor
method.summary:
Uses existing color as background, overlay arguement foreground color, and return a new RGB color.
If foreground color doesn't have any transparency, it will return foreground color as the new color.

param.name: fgColor
param.summary: Color object to use as Foreground Color

method.name: Tint
method.summary: NOT READY !! - Uses existing color as the Background and will over lay the parameter foreground with Alpha to return a new color RGB.

param.name: fgColor
param.summary: Color object to use as Foreground Color

method.name: Details
method.summary: One object with CMYK, HSV, HSL, and HEX within it.
